definition.value: This is an AE which is the bumps on a person's skin at the base of body hairs which may involuntarily develop when a person is tickled, cold or experiencing strong emotions such as fear, euphoria or sexual arousal.
This is an AE which is the infection and inflammation of one or more hair follicles.
This is an AE which is a medical condition involving the loss of all body hair, including eyebrows, eyelashes, chest hair, armpit hair, and pubic hair.
This is an AE which is a condition of abnormal hair patterns, predominantly loss or reduction.
This is an AE which is a persistent irritation caused by shaving.
This is an AE which is a clinical entity with a diversified aetiology, that allows to distinguish from circumscribed or cicatricial alopecia or male baldness.
This is an AE which refers to a loss of hair from part of the head or body with effluvium.
This is an AE which has been largely considered a neurological catastrophe. With conventional treatment, only around 20% of patients achieve functional independence.
This is an AE which include neuromuscular irritability, tetany, and seizures, which are rapidly resolved with intravenous administration of calcium gluconate.
This is an AE which is a  decrease in the total amount of neurogenic red blood cells (RBCs) or hemoglobin in the blood or a lowered ability of the blood to carry oxygen.
This is an AE which is a cancer of plasma cells, a type of white blood cell that normally produces antibodies.
This is an AE which is a global health concern affecting children, women and the elderly, whilst also being a common comorbidity in multiple medical conditions.
This is an AE which is a group of blood disorders typically inherited from a person's parents.
This is an AE which is a group of rare blood cancers in which excess red blood cells, white blood cells or platelets are produced in the bone marrow.
This is an AE which is a life-threatening condition caused by haemophilus that arises when the body's response to infection causes injury to its own tissues and organs.
This is an AE which is a process with hyperchloraemic causing increased acidity in the blood and other body tissues .
This is an AE which is an acquired autoimmune disorder resulting in the production of antibodies directed against red blood cell antigens causing shortened erythrocyte survival.
This is an AE which is an acquired autoimmune disorder resulting in the production of antibodies directed against red blood cell antigens causing shortened erythrocyte survival.
This is an AE which is infections present in the blood caused by bacillus.
This is an AE which is infections present in the blood caused by corynebacterium.
This is an AE which is infections present in the blood caused by haemophilus.
This is an AE which is the cells of the immune system that are involved in protecting the body against both infectious disease and foreign invaders .
This is an AE which is the formation of a blood clot inside a haemorrhoids blood vessel, obstructing the flow of blood through the circulatory system.
This is an AE which is well recognized and not infrequent findings in hyperthyroidism in adults.
This is an AE which occurs when a blood clot forms in the artery that provides blood flow to the peripheral.
This is an AE which refers to a term for the presence of toxins in the blood caused by staphylococcal.

This is an AE which is a form of anemia due to hemolysis, the abnormal breakdown of red blood cells (RBCs), either in the blood vessels (intravascular hemolysis) or elsewhere in the human body (extravascular).
This is an AE which is a group of blood disorders characterized by low red blood cells, acute kidney failure, and low platelets.
This is an AE which is a common cause of infection among acute myeloid leukemia (AML) patients.
This is an AE which is a decrease in the total amount of red blood cells (RBCs) or hemoglobin in the blood or a lowered ability of the blood to carry oxygen.

This is an AE which occurs when antibodies directed against the person's own red blood cells (RBCs) cause them to burst (lyse), leading to an insufficient number of oxygen-carrying red blood cells in the circulation.
This is an AE which is a type of macrocytic anemia. An anemia is a red blood cell defect that can lead to an undersupply of oxygen.
This is an AE which can be due to blood loss, decreased RBC production, or increased destruction of erythrocytes.
This is an AE which is a form of anemia seen in chronic infection, chronic immune activation, and malignancy.
This is an AE which is a decrease in the total red blood cells (RBCs) or hemoglobin in the blood during pregnancy.

This is an AE which occurs when antibodies directed against the person's own red blood cells (RBCs) cause them to burst (lyse), leading to an insufficient number of oxygen-carrying red blood cells in the circulation.

This is an AE which is a type of streptococcus infection and  beta-hemolytic is a complete lysis of red cells in the media around and under the colonies: the area appears lightened (yellow) and transparent.
This is an AE which is a condition in which the white cell (leukocyte count) is above the normal range in the blood.
This is an AE which is a group of blood cancers that usually begin in the bone marrow and result in high numbers of abnormal blood cells.
This is an AE which is a condition in which the white cell (leukocyte count) is above the normal range in the blood.
This is an AE which is a long-term skin condition characterized by patches of the skin losing their pigment.
This is an AE which is a medical emergency most commonly seen in patients with acute myeloid leukemia.
This is an AE which is a rare autosomal recessive disorder that arises from a mutation of a lysosomal trafficking regulator protein,which leads to a decrease in phagocytosis.
This is an AE which is a skin condition, a variant of acrocyanosis caused by chronic exposure to cold.
This is an AE which is a rare form of acute myeloid leukemia (less than 5% of AML cases) where the myeloproliferation is of erythroblastic precursors.
This is an AE which is a fairly disabling microvascular phenomenon.
This is an AE which is variation in cell shape: poikilocytes may be oval, teardrop-shaped, sickle-shaped or irregularly contracted.
This is an AE which is a disease state in which the hematocrit (the volume percentage of red blood cells in the blood) and/or hemoglobin concentration are elevated in peripheral blood.
This is an AE which is the medical term for an abnormal decrease of reticulocytes in the body.
This is an AE which is a condition where there is an increase in reticulocytes, immature red blood cells.
